Trial_Design.evidence: One hundred fifty-three subjects at 7 sites received a blinded infusion followed by open-label SNP during operative procedures requiring controlled hypotension.

Intervention.evidence: One hundred fifty-three subjects at 7 sites received a blinded infusion followed by open-label SNP during operative procedures requiring controlled hypotension.

Objective.evidence: We evaluated the dose-response relationship of SNP in infants and children undergoing major surgery and performed a quantitative assessment of BP control.

Method_Outcome.evidence: BP was recorded using an arterial catheter.

Blinding.evidence: blinded infusion followed by open-label SNP

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred fifty-three subjects at 7 sites

Result_Outcome.evidence: BP was controlled an average 45.4% (SD 23.9%, 95% CI 41.5%-49.18%) of the time.
